intro: Lathyroides, commonly known as the yellow lily of the valley, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asparagaceae. It is characterized by its attractive, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or yellow in color. The plant produces small, round berries that mature to a dark red or black hue. Lathyroides thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and natural landscapes.
